note:
I'm a Games User Researcher and PhD candidate focused on game accessibility. I also work with teaching and manage a mental health service. I've contributed to various games including Life is Strange 2, Onrush & Surviving Mars.

I play games, own a dog, skate and love music and film. I'm happy to chat and toot about anything related to the above. Also if you want advice on getting into games and games user research as a field, feel free to reach out.

Hey, I'm a game developer working in the industry and academia as a Games User Researcher and Accessibility Specialist.

I'm currently a PhD candidate at the University of York, studying game accessibility. Previously I worked at Player Research where I contributed to games such as Onrush, Life is Strange 2, Surviving Mars and FIFA19.

I also have a background in psychology and mental health, as well as an interest in a variety of different topics. Check my pinned post for more.
